page.title: 04CUSTOMS & EXCISE DOWNDERRY
page.content: EASY ACCESS FROM SEA AND LAND MADE DOWNDERRY AN IDEAL LANDING FOR SMUGGLED GOODS.ONE OF THE MAJOR COMMUNITIES TO DEVELOP WAS THUS THE CUSTOMS OR REVENUE BUILDING,LATER TO BE MANNED BY COASTGUARDS.THE BUILDINGS AND THE INTEGRAL BOATHOUSE ARE NOW OCCUPIED AS DWELLINGS.SOME PROVIDE YEAR ROUND HOMES eg AN EYE SURGEON LIVES THERE.OTHERS PROVIDE SECOND HOMES eg A PRISON GOVERNOR RELAXES THERE.STILL OTHERS ARE LET TO SUMMER VISITORS AS LUXURY COTTAGES,DESPITE THEIR HUMBLE ORIGINS.THESE LETS RAISE NOT INCONSIDERABLE INCOMES FOR OWNERS WHO DO NOT LIVE IN THE VILLAGE.PERHAPS THE REVENUE OFFICERS SHOULD BE INVITED TO RETURN. THE OWNERS OF THE PREMIER COTTAGE STILL MAINTAIN A CUSTOM FROM THE NAVAL DAYS WITH A FLAGPOLE FLYING THE UNION FLAG WHEN THEY ARE IN RESIDENCE.
